sorular.soru: When can you have an Educational Measure Behaviour and Traffic (EMG) imposed?
cevaplar: If you are guilty of dangerous driving behaviour.
If your health certificate gives cause to do so.
If you are guilty of driving under the influence of alcohol.
sorular.dogruCevap: If you are guilty of dangerous driving behaviour.

feedback.metin: If you are guilty of dangerous or risky driving (article 5), the CBR can impose an Educational Measure Behaviour and Traffic (EMG) on you. During the EMG course, you will learn to participate in traffic in a safe manner. The course consists of a personal intake and 3 course days. You must pay these costs yourself. If you fail to pay or show up, your driving licence will be suspended immediately.

sorular.soru: Should you give right of way to the cyclist?

feedback.metin: The cyclist is on the same road heading straight on and therefore has right of way. Although the cycle path is not directly parallel to the road, it is still part of the road.

sorular.soru: What is the maximum length of a combination of a passenger car with a trailer?

feedback.metin: A combination of a passenger car with a trailer may not exceed 18 metres in length.

sorular.soru: Can you reverse after passing this sign?

feedback.metin: Reversing, turning around, or waiting on the carriageway is prohibited on autowegen and motorways.

sorular.soru: You want to follow the road to the left. Should you give way to the cyclist?

feedback.metin: At equivalent intersections, drivers must give way to drivers coming from the right for them. The cyclist is a driver and is coming from the right relative to you. The cyclist therefore has priority. It makes no difference here whether the road to the right is a cycle path or a carriageway for motor vehicles.

sorular.soru: You want to follow the main road to the left. Should you indicate direction?

feedback.metin: The B-5 sign in combination with the supplementary plate indicates that you are approaching an intersection where the main road bends to the left. If you want to continue on this main road, you have priority over drivers from the side roads. You must indicate left because you are turning left.

sorular.soru: Should you use the rear fog lights?

feedback.metin: When it rains, you may never use rear fog lights, as this may blind drivers behind you. In case of fog or snowfall, this is only allowed when visibility is less than 50 metres.

sorular.soru: What should you do in this situation?

feedback.metin: If there are children playing on the footpath or pavement, you do not have to stop immediately, but you do have to drive in an adapted way. This means that you reduce the speed and take into account the fact that children are playful and often do not pay attention. Sometimes they can suddenly run into the street. Honking is only allowed if there is a danger. As long as the children do not run on the road, this is not yet the case.

sorular.soru: Should you expect oncoming motorcyclists here?

feedback.metin: The C-3 sign indicates a one-way street. The supplementary plate, however, indicates that the sign above it only applies to drivers of motor vehicles. You should not expect oncoming motorcyclists here. However, you can expect cyclists, snorfietsen, and mopeds.

sorular.soru: Do you have to give way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: Pedestrians with a walker fall under the category 'limited mobility'. You must give way and allow them to cross.

sorular.soru: From what maximum authorised mass is an emergency brake system on a trailer or caravan mandatory?

feedback.metin: Trailers with a maximum authorised mass of up to 1500 kg must be fitted with either an auxiliary coupling or an emergency brake system. Trailers above this weight shall be fitted with an emergency braking system.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the ambulance?

feedback.metin: An ambulance using optical and sound signals is an emergency vehicle. You must always give way if it is safe to do so.

sorular.soru: Is the road surface on a bridge often more slippery in the winter?

feedback.metin: The road surface on a bridge is often more slippery than regular road surfaces during the winter. This is because the road surface on a bridge is frozen from both above and below, while the ground beneath a regular road is usually warmer than the air directly above the road.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here?

feedback.metin: The E-2 sign indicates that you are not allowed to stop on this side of the road. However, this does not apply to parking spaces. If, like here, there are parking spaces on the side of the road where the E-2 sign is placed, you may park in those spaces.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light comes on?
cevaplar: Stop immediately and check the oil level.
Keep driving and refill the windscreen washer fluid at home.
Stop immediately and check the coolant level.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop immediately and check the coolant level.

feedback.metin: This light warns of excessive engine temperature. This means that there is something wrong with the engine's cooling system. Move the vehicle directly to the side of the road and check the coolant level. Never check the coolant level as long as the engine is still hot, but wait for it to cool down. Hot coolant can cause severe burns. Call the breakdown service if necessary, for instance when you are standing on the hard shoulder or when you suspect leakage.

sorular.soru: The car's maximum authorised mass is 2400 kg and the trailer's 850 kg. What driving licence do you at least need to drive this combination?

feedback.metin: With a B driving licence, you may tow a trailer with a maximum authorised mass of up to 750 kg or a heavier trailer if the maximum combined weight does not exceed 3500 kg. With a BE driving licence, you are also allowed to drive heavier combinations, as long as the trailer is no heavier than 3500 kg. This question refers to a trailer heavier than 750 kg. The total combined weight remains under 3500 kg (namely 2400 + 850 = 3250). Hence, the B driving licence is sufficient.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here?

feedback.metin: The E-7 sign indicates that you can only load and unload goods here. Parking is prohibited here.

sorular.soru: May an authorised person of the Tax and Customs Administration check your vehicle registration card?

feedback.metin: You are required to show the vehicle registration card if requested to do so by authorised persons. This can be a police officer, but also someone from the Royal Netherlands Military Constabulary, the tax authorities or customs.

sorular.soru: Are you driving in the correct lane?

feedback.metin: You should always position yourself as far to the right as possible. To overtake the vehicle up ahead, you do not yet need to drive in the middle lane. You must, therefore, move one lane to the right.

sorular.soru: You want to turn left. Are you pre-sorted correctly here?

feedback.metin: You are driving on a carriageway with separated lanes. In that case, oncoming traffic is driving on the other side of the central reservation. When turning left, you pre-sort on the left lane.

sorular.soru: You made a mistake and actually want to go straight. Are you still allowed to change lanes?

feedback.metin: You can no longer change lanes here. The bus lane is marked with solid lines, which means you cannot cross them. You must turn right here.

sorular.soru: The child is 1.50 metres. Is this the right way to transport this child?

feedback.metin: A three-point belt may not be used as a lap belt. Children smaller than 1.35 m must use an approved car seat or seat booster. Children taller than 1.35 m must use the seat belt whether or not in combination with a booster seat. The upper part of the belt must be placed across the front of the chest and over the shoulder.

sorular.soru: You want to turn right, and so does the bus behind you. Can you drive on?

feedback.metin: If there are no special bus lanes, buses use the normal lanes. Such a shared lane can be provided with both a normal traffic light and a public transport light (nine-eye). Only the driver of a public bus bus may follow this nine-eye light and in this case, drive through the red light intended for you. You are not allowed to do this; you must wait for the red light to turn green, even if you hold up the bus in doing so.

sorular.soru: You want to get in lane in front of the red lorry. Are you allowed to use a bit of the hard shoulder?

feedback.metin: You are only allowed to use the hard shoulder in case of emergency. The fact that you decide you still want to overtake the lorry is not an emergency. You are therefore not allowed to use the hard shoulder for this. You could have easily gotten in lane behind the lorry.

sorular.soru: Who is allowed to go first?
cevaplar: The driver of the passenger car.

feedback.metin: The cyclist is turning right and has the short turn, while the driver of the passenger car wants to turn left and has the long turn. Here the following applies: the short bend takes precedence over the long bend.

sorular.soru: In which situation do you have to let the lorry go first?

feedback.metin: Only in situation B do you have to let the lorry go first. Because you both want to enter the same side road, the rule applies where the driver turning right can go before the driver turning left. In situation A, you turn right, meaning you can go first. In situation B the lorry turns right and therefore you have to give way to the driver.

sorular.soru: Are you a driver if you push a bike by hand?

feedback.metin: If you walk with a bicycle in your hand, you fall under the category of pedestrians. You are only a driver if you are riding the bicycle.

sorular.soru: What happens to stopping distance when you drive a caravan?

feedback.metin: If you are driving a car pulling a caravan, you are handling more weight when coming to a standstill. More weight means a longer braking distance and therefore a longer stopping distance. Despite the fact a larger caravan is often braked, this brake only comes into effect when the car brakes for the caravan. With a caravan, there is always more forward force on the car when braking, so the stopping distance will be longer.

sorular.soru: Which mirrors on a passenger car are mandatory?
cevaplar: A right wing mirror and a rear-view mirror.
A left and right wing mirror and an rear-view mirror.
A left and right wing mirror.
sorular.dogruCevap: A left and right wing mirror and an rear-view mirror.

feedback.metin: A passenger car must have at least a rear-view mirror and a left and right wing mirror.

sorular.soru: Is it wise to switch on your hazard lights when you encounter a traffic jam?

feedback.metin: When approaching a traffic jam, warn traffic behind you by turning on the hazard lights. As soon as the vehicle behind you turns on their hazard lights, you may switch off your own. Approach traffic jams with adjusted speed, check the mirrors regularly, and take into account motorcyclists who may drive through the traffic jam.

sorular.soru: Should you give right of way to the cyclist?

feedback.metin: You must give the cyclist right of way. This is an equivalent intersection, as signs do not regulate the right of way. Nor does it matter whether the road from the right is a cobbled road or an asphalt road, as both roads are paved. There is also no road designated as an exit construction. At equivalent intersections, drivers must give right of way to those coming from the right. Cyclists also fall into the category of drivers.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake like this?

feedback.metin: Hatched road markings are a part of the carriageway on which slanted stripes are painted. Hatched road markings are often found in road narrowing where the number of lanes is reduced. You are not allowed to drive on hatched road markings.

sorular.soru: Should you expect the motorcyclist to drive in between the traffic jams?

feedback.metin: Motorcyclists are allowed to drive between cars in slow-moving and stationary traffic jams if the difference in speed does not exceed 10 km/h and if it is done carefully. This is only allowed between the two left lanes.

sorular.soru: Who should you give way to when coming out of an unpaved road?
cevaplar: Drivers from the left and right on the paved road.
All road users from the left and right on the paved road.
sorular.dogruCevap: Drivers from the left and right on the paved road.

feedback.metin: The rule 'give way to drivers from the right' does not apply when the driver coming from the right is coming from an unpaved road. So, if you are coming from an unpaved road, you should give way to drivers from the left and right. All other rules regarding priority stay the same, regardless whether the road is paved or unpaved. So pedestrians are not suddenly allowed to go first when crossing an unpaved road. You can therefore best compare exiting an unpaved road to approaching priority triangles.

sorular.soru: Should you wait here for the traffic light until there is enough space?

feedback.metin: You may only enter an intersection if you can clear it immediately. This is not the case here, as the intersection is full and the vehicles are braking. There is not yet enough space beyond the intersection. Only when this is the case may you continue, unless the traffic light is yellow or red again.

sorular.soru: What colour should the reversing light emit?

feedback.metin: The reversing light is intended to illuminate the road behind you while reversing and to make it clear to other road users that you are reversing. The colour of the reversing light is white or yellow.

sorular.soru: Should you expect a brommobiel here?

feedback.metin: You do not have to expect brommobielen here. Only vehicles that can and are allowed to travel at a speed of at least 50 km/h may use autowegen. Brommobielen are therefore not allowed on autowegen, regardless of whether they are within or outside of a built-up area and what the local speed limit is.

sorular.soru: Until where does the parking disc zone apply?
cevaplar: Until a sign indicating the end of the parking disc zone.
sorular.dogruCevap: Until a sign indicating the end of the parking disc zone.

feedback.metin: A zone sign is valid throughout the zone until the end of the zone is indicated by a sign.

sorular.soru: Can you drive here?

feedback.metin: This road is closed to all motor vehicles with more than two wheels. Motorcyclists are therefore allowed to drive here if they are on a two-wheeled motorcycle.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to change lanes?

feedback.metin: You may change lanes at the block marking. Pay attention and take care not to obstruct traffic behind you and traffic on other lanes. However, if you are not at an intersection with pre-sorting lanes for different directions, but a through lane with exit lane, such as on the motorway, you may not re-enter the through lane once there are directional arrows on the exit lane.

sorular.soru: The reverse gear is malfunctioning. Are you allowed to drive?

feedback.metin: Certain parts of a car must always work properly before it can legally be driven. These are called permanent requirements. Reverse gear is one such requirement, so you may not drive with a defective or incorrectly functioning reverse gear.

sorular.soru: Can you park here?

feedback.metin: Parking within 5 metres - approximately 1 car length - of an intersection is not allowed.
